articles.author: Marlene Cimons
articles.title: Why gorillas' viruses are of interest to human scientists - The Washington Post
articles.description: Gorilla researchers in Africa gather saliva samples from partially chewed leaves that the primates discard after eating. The scientists then extract the DNA and analyze it for viruses.
articles.content:
Comment on this story
African mountain gorillas are picky eaters. They strip off the most delicious bits of plants and spit out the rest, leaving a trail of partially chewed leaves drenched in saliv… [+10257 chars]
